title: The Opulence of the Absolute
introduction: Chapter 10 of the Bhagavad Gita, Vibhuti Yoga (The Yoga of Divine Opulences), is one of the most awe-inspiring and devotional chapters in the entire scripture. Having revealed His personal nature and the supremacy of devotion in Chapter 9, Krishna now responds to Arjuna’s request to describe His divine manifestations (vibhutis) — the most magnificent, glorious, and powerful expressions of Himself in the universe. This is Krishna’s loving answer to the devotee who longs to see and feel God everywhere. He lists dozens of His supreme opulences — the best, the first, the strongest, the most beautiful, the most essential in every category — so that Arjuna (and every reader) can train the mind to recognize the Divine presence in the grandeur of creation. For modern readers — living in a world of Instagram aesthetics, awe at nature documentaries, scientific wonder at the cosmos, and the search for meaning in everyday life — this chapter is a direct invitation: stop looking for God only in temples or meditation cushions; see Him in the majesty of mountains, the brilliance of the sun, the strength of leaders, the beauty of art, the intelligence of science, the love in relationships. The essence remains perfectly intact: Krishna is not distant — He is the source of all splendor, and by meditating on His opulences, the devotee’s heart becomes saturated with love, wonder, and constant remembrance of the Supreme Person.

shlokas.sanskrit:
श्रीभगवानुवाच |
भूय एव महाबाहो शृणु मे परमं वचः |
यत्तेऽहं प्रीयमाणाय वक्ष्यामि हितकाम्यया ||
shlokas.transliteration:
śrī-bhagavān uvāca
bhūya eva mahā-bāho śṛṇu me paramaṁ vacaḥ
yat te ’haṁ prīyamāṇāya vakṣyāmi hita-kāmyayā
shlokas.translation: The Supreme Personality of Godhead said: My dear Arjuna, listen once more to My supreme word, which I shall impart to you for your benefit and which will give you great joy.
shlokas.modern: Krishna begins with affection: 'Listen again, strong-armed one — I’m going to speak even more confidentially because I love you and want your highest good.' This is the tone of a friend who wants to share his deepest secrets. In 2026 life: most teachers repeat basics; Krishna says 'let me go deeper because you’re ready and because I care.' This verse sets the emotional climate — the coming revelations are given out of love, not obligation. For anyone who has ever felt spiritually stuck or unworthy, Krishna’s warmth here is medicine: the Divine wants to share more with you because you matter to Him.

shlokas.sanskrit:
न मे विदुः सुरगणाः प्रभवं न महर्षयः |
अहमादिर्हि देवानां महर्षीणां च सर्वशः ||
shlokas.transliteration:
na me viduḥ sura-gaṇāḥ prabhavaṁ na maharṣayaḥ
aham ādir hi devānāṁ maharṣīṇāṁ ca sarvaśaḥ
shlokas.translation: Neither the hosts of demigods nor the great sages know My origin or opulences, for in every respect I am the source of the demigods and sages.
shlokas.modern: Even the gods and great sages don’t fully know My origin or My divine glories — I am the source of them all. This establishes Krishna’s supremacy. In 2026 terms: the Divine is not a product of evolution, mythology, or human imagination — He is the origin of everything divine and wise. Even the highest beings in the cosmos don’t fully comprehend Him. This creates healthy awe: stop trying to fit God into your mental box — He is the box-maker. This verse humbles the intellect and opens the heart to wonder.

shlokas.sanskrit:
यो मामजमनादिं च वेत्ति लोकमहेश्वरम् |
असंमूढः स मर्त्येषु सर्वपापैः प्रमुच्यते ||
shlokas.transliteration:
yo mām ajam anādiṁ ca vetti loka-maheśvaram
asaṁmūḍhaḥ sa martyeṣu sarva-pāpaiḥ pramucyate
shlokas.translation: He who knows Me as the unborn, as the beginningless, as the Supreme Lord of all the worlds — he is undeluded among men and is freed from all sinful reactions.
shlokas.modern: Whoever knows Me as unborn, beginningless, and the supreme master of all worlds — that person is free from illusion and all sin. This is the liberating knowledge. In practice: recognize the Divine as eternal, without origin, and the ultimate authority over everything — this understanding alone cleanses karma and ends confusion. In 2026 life: most people see God as a concept, a force, or a historical figure. Krishna says: know Me as the timeless, causeless source — that realization is freedom. This verse is a direct pointer to non-dual yet personal truth — and it promises purification simply through correct knowing.

shlokas.sanskrit:
बुद्धिर्ज्ञानमसंमोहः क्षमा सत्यं दमः शमः |
सुखं दुःखं भवोऽभावो भयं चाभयमेव च ||
shlokas.transliteration:
buddhir jñānam asaṁmohaḥ kṣamā satyaṁ damaḥ śamaḥ
sukhaṁ duḥkhaṁ bhavo ’bhāvo bhayaṁ cābhayam eva ca
shlokas.translation: Intelligence, knowledge, freedom from doubt and delusion, forgiveness, truthfulness, control of the senses and mind, happiness and distress, birth, death, fear, fearlessness, nonviolence, equanimity, satisfaction, austerity, charity, fame and infamy — all these various qualities of living beings are created by Me alone.
shlokas.modern: Krishna lists dualities and qualities (intelligence, knowledge, confusion, forgiveness, truth, self-control, pleasure/pain, birth/death, fear/fearlessness, nonviolence, balance, contentment, austerity, charity, fame/infamy) — all come from Him. This is total sovereignty. In 2026: every positive and negative trait, every emotion, every state you experience — the Divine is the source. This ends blame and pride. You’re not the author of your virtues or vices — they are divine energies manifesting through you. Knowing this brings humility and detachment: 'All these are from You — I am just the instrument.' This verse turns psychology and self-improvement into devotion.

shlokas.sanskrit:
ऋषयः सप्त पूर्वे चत्वारो मनवस्तथा |
मद्भावा मानसा जाता येषां लोक इमाः प्रजाः ||
shlokas.transliteration:
ṛṣayaḥ sapta pūrve catvāro manavas tathā
mad-bhāvā mānasā jātā yeṣāṁ loka imāḥ prajāḥ
shlokas.translation: The seven great sages and before them the four other great sages and the Manus [progenitors of mankind] come from Me, born of My mind, and all the living beings descend from them.
shlokas.modern: The seven rishis, the four Kumaras, the Manus — all born from My mind — and all beings descend from them. Krishna reveals Himself as the source of cosmic intelligence and human lineage. In practice: the great seers and progenitors are not independent — they are extensions of divine mind. This connects personal life to cosmic origin. In 2026: science traces human origins; Krishna traces them to divine consciousness. This verse inspires reverence for wisdom traditions and reminds us that intelligence itself is divine.

shlokas.sanskrit:
एतां विभूतिं योगं च मम यो वेत्ति तत्त्वतः |
सोऽविकम्पेन योगेन युज्यते नात्र संशयः ||
shlokas.transliteration:
etāṁ vibhūtiṁ yogaṁ ca mama yo vetti tattvataḥ
so ’vikampena yogena yujyate nātra saṁśayaḥ
shlokas.translation: One who knows in truth this glory and power of Mine engages in unshakeable devotional service. Of this there is no doubt.
shlokas.modern: Whoever truly understands My opulences and yogic power becomes fixed in unwavering devotion — no doubt. This is the result of vibhuti knowledge: unshakable bhakti. In practice: when you see the Divine’s greatness in creation, your love becomes steady. Krishna is saying: intellectual understanding of My majesty leads to heart-level devotion. This verse connects jnana and bhakti — knowing My glory makes love firm. In 2026: when awe at the universe or beauty of life turns your mind to the Source, devotion becomes natural and unbreakable. This is the fruit of the chapter.

shlokas.sanskrit:
एतां विभूतिं योगं च मम यो वेत्ति तत्त्वतः |
सोऽविकम्पेन योगेन युज्यते नात्र संशयः ||
shlokas.transliteration:
etāṁ vibhūtiṁ yogaṁ ca mama yo vetti tattvataḥ
so ’vikampena yogena yujyate nātra saṁśayaḥ
shlokas.translation: One who knows in truth this glory and power of Mine engages in unshakeable devotional service. Of this there is no doubt.
shlokas.modern: (Repeated for emphasis in some editions.) Krishna reiterates: true knowledge of My opulences leads to steady yoga (union). This verse is a promise — understanding My greatness removes wobble from devotion. In daily life: when doubt or dryness comes, remember the divine manifestations — sun, moon, strength, beauty — and love returns. This is the stabilizer for the spiritual path.

shlokas.sanskrit:
अहम् सर्वस्य प्रभवो मत्तः सर्वं प्रवर्तते |
इति मत्वा भजन्ते मां बुद्धिमन्तः समन्विताः ||
shlokas.transliteration:
aham sarvasya prabhavo mattaḥ sarvaṁ pravartate
iti matvā bhajante māṁ buddhimantaḥ samanvitāḥ
shlokas.translation: I am the source of all spiritual and material worlds. Everything emanates from Me. The wise who perfectly know this engage in My devotional service and worship Me with all their hearts.
shlokas.modern: I am the origin of everything — knowing this, the wise worship Me with full hearts. This is the turning point. In practice: when you realize 'everything comes from Him,' devotion becomes natural and wholehearted. The intelligent don’t just acknowledge — they respond with love. In 2026: science shows interconnectedness; Krishna says the source is personal and loving. Knowing this turns wonder into worship. This verse is the bridge from knowledge to bhakti — see the source and love the source.

shlokas.sanskrit:
मच्चित्ता मद्गतप्राणा बोधयन्तः परस्परम् |
कथयन्तश्च मां नित्यं तुष्यन्ति च रमन्ति च ||
shlokas.transliteration:
mac-cittā mad-gata-prāṇā bodhayantaḥ parasparam
kathayantaś ca māṁ nityaṁ tuṣyanti ca ramanti ca
shlokas.translation: The thoughts of My pure devotees dwell in Me, their lives are fully devoted to My service, and they derive great satisfaction and bliss from always enlightening one another and conversing about Me.
shlokas.modern: My devotees fix their minds on Me, dedicate their lives to Me, enlighten each other, and find constant joy in talking about Me. This is the picture of a thriving spiritual community. In 2026: satsang — friends who share spiritual insights, discuss the Divine, inspire each other — brings deep fulfillment. Krishna is describing the joy of devotional friendship. Talking about God with others who love Him is bliss. This verse makes community essential — not optional. The highest happiness comes from shared remembrance and love.

shlokas.sanskrit:
तेषां सततयुक्तानां भजतां प्रीतिपूर्वकम् |
ददामि बुद्धियोगं तं येन मामुपयान्ति ते ||
shlokas.transliteration:
teṣāṁ satata-yuktānāṁ bhajatāṁ prīti-pūrvakam
dadāmi buddhi-yogaṁ taṁ yena mām upayānti te
shlokas.translation: To those who are constantly devoted to serving Me with love, I give the understanding by which they can come to Me.
shlokas.modern: To those who serve Me constantly with love, I personally grant the intelligence that takes them to Me. This is divine grace in action. In practice: sincere loving service attracts divine insight. Krishna says: 'I give them the buddhi-yoga — the yoga of intelligence — to reach Me.' This is why devotees often have sudden clarity or intuitive guidance. The more you love and serve, the more the Divine illuminates your mind. This verse is pure reassurance — your effort is met with help from above.

shlokas.sanskrit:
तेषामेवानुकम्पार्थमहमज्ञानजं तमः |
नाशयाम्यात्मभावस्थो ज्ञानदीपेन भास्वता ||
shlokas.transliteration:
teṣām evānukampārtham aham ajñāna-jaṁ tamaḥ
nāśayāmy ātma-bhāva-stho jñāna-dīpena bhāsvatā
shlokas.translation: To show them special mercy, I, dwelling in their hearts, destroy with the shining lamp of knowledge the darkness born of ignorance.
shlokas.modern: Out of compassion, I live in their hearts and destroy ignorance with the bright lamp of knowledge. This is the most intimate promise. Krishna personally enters the devotee’s heart and lights the inner lamp. In 2026 life: when confusion, doubt, or darkness arises — sincere devotees receive inner clarity and illumination directly from the Divine. This verse explains sudden insights, breakthroughs, or 'aha' moments in spiritual life. The Divine is not external — He is the light within. This is the ultimate intimacy — God as your inner guru.

shlokas.sanskrit:
अर्जुन उवाच |
परं ब्रह्म परं धाम पवित्रं परमं भवान् |
पुरुषं शाश्वतं दिव्यमादिदेवमजं विभुम् ||
shlokas.transliteration:
arjuna uvāca
paraṁ brahma paraṁ dhāma pavitraṁ paramaṁ bhavān
puruṣaṁ śāśvataṁ divyam ādi-devam ajaṁ vibhum
shlokas.translation: Arjuna said: You are the Supreme Personality of Godhead, the ultimate abode, the purest, the Absolute Truth. You are the eternal, transcendental, original Person, the unborn, and the greatest.
shlokas.modern: Arjuna’s ecstatic response: You are the Supreme Brahman, the ultimate shelter, the purest, the eternal divine Person, the original Godhead, unborn, all-pervading. This is the devotee’s heart-melted recognition. In practice: when Krishna’s glories are heard, the heart responds with praise and surrender. Arjuna models the proper response — not intellectual analysis, but loving affirmation. This verse is pure bhakti — seeing and declaring the Divine’s greatness.

shlokas.sanskrit:
आहुस्त्वामृषयः सर्वे देवर्षिर्नारदस्तथा |
असितो देवलो व्यासः स्वयं चैव ब्रवीषि मे ||
shlokas.transliteration:
āhus tvām ṛṣayaḥ sarve devarṣir nāradas tathā
asito devalo vyāsaḥ svayaṁ caiva bravīṣi me
shlokas.translation: All the great sages have declared You to be the Supreme Brahman, the original Personality of Godhead, the greatest of all beings, the original Lord, the unborn, and the all-pervading. And now You Yourself are confirming this to me.
shlokas.modern: All sages — Narada, Asita, Devala, Vyasa — proclaim You as the Supreme. And now You confirm it Yourself. Arjuna is overjoyed — the scriptures and the Lord agree. In 2026: when personal experience matches ancient wisdom, faith becomes unshakable. Arjuna is saying: 'Everything I’ve heard from teachers is now confirmed by You directly.' This is the moment of complete trust. This verse shows the harmony of revelation — shastra (scripture) and guru (Krishna) speak the same truth.

shlokas.sanskrit:
सर्वमेतदृतं मन्ये यन्मां वदसि केशव |
न हि ते भगवन्मूर्तिर्व्यक्तिं वेद न दानवाः ||
shlokas.transliteration:
sarvam etad ṛtaṁ manye yan māṁ vadasi keśava
na hi te bhagavan mūrtir vyaktiṁ veda na dānavāḥ
shlokas.translation: O Krishna, I totally accept as truth all the statements that You have told me. Neither the demigods nor the demons, O Lord, can understand Your personality.
shlokas.modern: Arjuna fully accepts Krishna’s words as truth — neither gods nor demons can understand His true nature. This is complete surrender and faith. In practice: when the Divine reveals Himself, the heart says 'yes' without reservation. This verse models perfect acceptance — no doubt, no argument. Arjuna is saying: 'I believe You because You said it, and because You are beyond even cosmic beings.' This ends skepticism and opens the heart fully.

shlokas.sanskrit:
स्वयमेवात्मनात्मानं वेत्सि त्वं पुरुषोत्तम |
भूतभावन भूतेश देवदेव जगत्पते ||
shlokas.transliteration:
svayam evātmanātmānaṁ vetsi tvaṁ puruṣottama
bhūta-bhāvana bhūteśa deva-deva jagat-pate
shlokas.translation: Indeed, You alone know Yourself by Your own potency, O origin of all, O Lord of all beings, O Lord of gods, O sustainer of the universe.
shlokas.modern: Only You know Yourself by Your own power — O Supreme Person, creator of beings, Lord of lords, master of the universe. Arjuna acknowledges Krishna’s self-luminosity. In practice: the Divine is self-knowing — no one can fully define or comprehend Him except Himself. This ends intellectual pride. Krishna is infinite — our understanding is always partial. This verse inspires humility and wonder — bow to the One who knows Himself completely.

shlokas.sanskrit:
वक्तुमर्हस्यशेषेण दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतयः |
याभिर्विभूतिभिर्लोकानिमांस्त्वं व्याप्य तिष्ठसि ||
shlokas.transliteration:
vaktum arhasy aśeṣeṇa divyā hy ātma-vibhūtayaḥ
yābhir vibhūtibhir lokān imāṁs tvaṁ vyāpya tiṣṭhasi
shlokas.translation: Please tell me in detail of Your divine opulences by which You pervade these worlds and by which You abide in them.
shlokas.modern: Arjuna’s loving request: 'Please describe in full Your divine opulences by which You pervade and reside in all these worlds.' This is the devotee’s longing to see God everywhere. In 2026: after hearing Krishna is all-pervading, the heart wants details — 'Show me where You are, how You manifest.' This verse is the bridge to the vibhuti list. Arjuna is asking for a guided tour of divinity in creation. This models healthy spiritual curiosity — not doubt, but desire to know and love more deeply.

shlokas.sanskrit:
कथं विद्यामहं योगिंस्त्वां सदा परिचिन्तयन् |
केषु केषु च भावेषु चिन्त्योऽसि भगवन्मया ||
shlokas.transliteration:
kathaṁ vidyām ahaṁ yogiṁs tvāṁ sadā paricintayan
keṣu keṣu ca bhāveṣu cintyo ’si bhagavan mayā
shlokas.translation: O Krishna, O Supreme Mystic, how shall I constantly meditate upon You? In what aspects should I think of You, O Supreme Personality of Godhead?
shlokas.modern: Arjuna asks practically: 'How can I always think of You? In which forms/aspects should I meditate on You?' This is the devotee’s intelligence — not abstract philosophy, but concrete practice. In 2026: 'I want to remember God all day — give me handles, focal points.' Krishna’s coming list is the answer — meditate on My highest manifestations in each category. This verse shows devotion is active and specific. Arjuna wants tools for constant remembrance. This is the heart of vibhuti yoga.

shlokas.sanskrit:
विस्तरेणात्मनो योगं विभूतिं च जनार्दन |
भूयः कथय तृप्तिर्हि शृण्वतो नास्ति मेऽमृतम् ||
shlokas.transliteration:
vistareṇātmano yogaṁ vibhūtiṁ ca janārdana
bhūyaḥ kathaya tṛptir hi śṛṇvato nāsti me ’mṛtam
shlokas.translation: O Janardana, again please describe in detail the mystic power of Your opulences by which You remain in these worlds. I am never satiated when I hear Your nectar-like words.
shlokas.modern: Arjuna pleads: 'Tell me more — in detail — about Your yoga and opulences. I’m never satisfied hearing Your words — they’re like nectar.' This is the devotee’s hunger. In practice: the more you hear about the Divine’s greatness, the more you want. Krishna’s glories are inexhaustible. This verse shows the joy of kirtan, reading, listening — it never gets old. Arjuna models insatiable love for divine topics. In 2026: when spiritual talks, books, or chants fill you with joy and you want more — that’s the sign of real progress.

shlokas.sanskrit:
श्रीभगवानुवाच |
हन्त ते कथयिष्यामि दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतयः |
याः श्रेष्ठाः पुरुषव्याघ्र निर्धनं ता शृणु मे ||
shlokas.transliteration:
śrī-bhagavān uvāca
hanta te kathayiṣyāmi divyā hy ātma-vibhūtayaḥ
yāḥ śreṣṭhāḥ puruṣa-vyāghra nirdhanaṁ tā śṛṇu me
shlokas.translation: The Supreme Personality of Godhead said: Yes, I shall tell you of My splendorous manifestations, which are prominent, O best of men, for there is no end to My opulences.
shlokas.modern: Krishna agrees enthusiastically: 'Yes! I’ll tell you My divine glories — the most prominent ones — because they are endless.' This is divine willingness to reveal. In practice: the Divine loves to share His greatness with sincere devotees. Krishna is excited to describe — this is not reluctant teaching. This verse sets the stage for the vibhuti list — a guided meditation on divine excellence. Krishna is saying: 'Let’s do this — I’ll show you My best expressions so you can meditate on them always.'

shlokas.sanskrit:
अहमात्मा गुडाकेश सर्वभूताशयस्थितः |
अहमादिश्च मध्यं च भूतानामन्त एव च ||
shlokas.transliteration:
aham ātmā guḍākeśa sarva-bhūtāśaya-sthitaḥ
aham ādiś ca madhyaṁ ca bhūtānām anta eva ca
shlokas.translation: I am the Supersoul, O Arjuna, seated in the hearts of all living entities. I am the beginning, the middle and the end of all beings.
shlokas.modern: I am the Supersoul in every heart — the beginning, middle, and end of all beings. This is the most intimate revelation. Krishna is in your heart right now — as your witness, guide, and essence. In 2026: when you feel alone, remember — the Divine is closer than your breath, living in your own heart. This ends separation. Krishna is the alpha and omega of everything — the source, sustainer, and destination. This verse is pure comfort and awe — God is not far away; He is your innermost companion.
